abstract: Background: This study evaluated immunogenicity and safety of the adjuvanted recombinant zoster vaccine (RZV) when the first dose was co-administered with the 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPSV23) in adults aged ≥50 years. Methods: In this open label, multi-center study (NCT02045836), participants were randomized 1:1 to receive either the first dose of RZV and PPSV23, co-administered at Day 0 and the second dose of RZV at Month 2 (Co-Ad group), or PPSV23 at Day 0, the first dose of RZV at Month 2 and second dose of RZV at Month 4 (Control group). Co-primary objectives were the RZV vaccine response rate (VRR) in the Co-Ad group and the non-inferiority of the antibody responses to RZV and PPSV23 in the Co-Ad group compared to the Control group. Reactogenicity and safety were also assessed. Results: 865 participants were vaccinated (Co-Ad: 432, Control: 433). VRRs to RZV were >98% in both groups. Humoral immune responses to co-administration of RZV and PPSV23 were non-inferior to sequential administration. All three co-primary immunogenicity objectives were met. Solicited local symptoms after the first RZV dose were reported by similar percentages of participants in both groups. Solicited general symptoms were more frequently reported when the first dose of RZV and PPSV23 were co-administered. No differences were apparent between groups after the second RZV dose. Conclusions: No immunologic interference was observed between RZV and PPSV23 when co-administered in adults ≥50 years. No safety concerns were raised.

author_highlights.sentence: Reactivation of latent varicella-zoster virus causes herpes zoster (HZ).
The adjuvanted recombinant zoster vaccine (RZV) is >90% efficacious against HZ in adults aged ≥50 years.
Immunogenicity and safety of RZV and PPSV23 were assessed when administered concomitantly or sequentially.
No immunologic interference was observed between RZV and PPSV23 when co-administered.
No safety concerns were identified during the study.

body_text.sentence: At the time this study was designed, PPSV23 was recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for the prevention of IPD in adults ≥65 YOA and in adults ≥19 YOA at increased risk for pneumococcal disease [20,21].
body_text.title: Introduction

body_text.sentence: This study showed that immunogenicity of two doses of RZV was unaffected by the co-administration of the first dose with PPSV23, and that immunogenicity of PPSV23 was also preserved when co-administered with the first RZV dose.
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: Exploratory analyses showed a moderate positive correlation between humoral and cellular immune responses during the first 3 years following 2 doses of RZV [31].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: The percentage of participants reporting local symptoms at the RZV injection site was similar in the 2 groups.
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: Shingrix is a trademark of the GSK group of companies.
body_text.title: Trademarks

body_text.sentence: Of note, these 12 serotypes are common to currently approved pneumococcal vaccines PPSV23 and PCV13 in the countries where the study was conducted.
body_text.title: Study design

body_text.sentence: Anti-gE antibody concentrations were measured using an anti-gE enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) with a cut-off of 97 milli International Units (mIU)/mL.
body_text.title: Assessment of immunogenicity

body_text.sentence: Non-fatal SAEs were reported by 15 and 17 participants in the Co-Ad and Control groups, respectively, none of which were considered related to vaccination by the investigators.
body_text.title: Reactogenicity and safety

body_text.sentence: HZ and/or HZ complications were collected until study end.
body_text.title: Assessment of safety

body_text.sentence: TCH is co-inventor of the patent application related to the vaccine used in this study and is currently a consultant for the GSK group of companies.
body_text.title: Declaration of interest

metadata.title: Immunogenicity and safety of the adjuvanted recombinant zoster vaccine co-administered with the 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine in adults ≥50 years of age: A randomized trial
